intro: Senecio integerrimus var. lugens, commonly known as the Silverleaf Senecio, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and drought-tolerant species within the Asteraceae family.
